name: Xia Ning
content: Xia Ning, PI | Ning Lab Ohio State nav bar Skip to main content The Ohio State University Help BuckeyeLink Map Find People Webmail Search Ohio State Xia Ning (宁夏; Ning is the last name), PhD, MS, MS, MBA, FAMIA, FACMI Professor Co-Lead, AI for Health, OSU AI(X) Hub Division Chief of AI in Digital Health Biomedical Informatics (BMI), College of Medicine, OSU Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), College of Engineering, OSU Division of Medicinal Chemistry and Pharmacognosy, College of Pharmacy (courtesy) Core Faculty, Translational Data Analytics Institute (TDAI) Dr. Xia Ning is a tenured Professor at The Ohio State University, holding appointments in the Colleges of Medicine, Engineering, and Pharmacy. She was trained as a Computer Scientist, specializing in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). A renowned leader in Biomedical Informatics and AI, she focuses on developing cutting-edge AI methodologies with transformative applications in medicine and healthcare, bridging the gap between computational innovation and real-world healthcare challenges. Dr. Ning has published more than 150 peer-reviewed articles in high-impact journals and prestigious venues, with notable breakthroughs highlighted in Nature’s special collection, and long-lasting impacts recognized by several awards. Her research has also received recognition from industry, OSU, the National Science Foundation, research communities, and social media. Her research programs have been extensively funded by the National Institute of Health (NIH), the National Science Foundation (NSF), and industry leaders. Dr. Ning has consistently served the research communities and has been recognized with service awards. In addition, with continued leadership training, education, and practices, Dr. Ning has unique qualifications and insights to develop and lead initiatives for Health AI innovation. She is currently a co-lead of the AI in Health pillar of the newly established OSU AI(X) Hub.
